revised_title: Mesodermal Patterns and Repeats in Starfish Bipinnaria Larva
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
tldr: The article describes the arrangement of body-wall musculature and supporting mesenchyme in the bipinnaria larva of Pisaster ochraceus. Four main cell types are identified, including generalized mesenchyme, dorsal longitudinal muscles, oral-field muscles, and subtrochal cells. Similar patterns of repeating elements are found in other echinoderm larvae, hemichordate tornaria larva, and chordates, suggesting a common underlying plan. The study provides insights into the evolution of chordate features and the possible antecedents of chordates.
